messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 264
messages.msgSnippet: I just want to ask if there are any Christian Unschoolers near the East Texas area....we are going to be moving there in a year or so.....just getting a head
messages.messageBody:
I just want to ask if there are any Christian Unschoolers near the East Texas
area....we are going to be moving there in a year or so.....just getting a
head start on looking for contacts : )
Sam

messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 264
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 10/23/99 9:06:21 PM Eastern Daylight Time, rpaul@suffolk.lib.ny.us writes:
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 10/23/99 9:06:21 PM Eastern Daylight Time,
rpaul@... writes:

<< We are Christians. I really liked this article! I was so excited to see
that others were "unschooling" as well. All of the Christians we know who
homeschool all have school in the home. Very very rigid. >>

We are too. I know of another family nearby but like you most I know
follow a pretty rigid curriculum. I'm glad to know of others.

Laura

messages.subject: Re: Digest Number 264
messages.msgSnippet: Hi!  I m Diane.  We re new to this list.  So far, I really like it :-) We are unschoolers in NY.  We re having our share of problems.  But I ll share them as
messages.messageBody:
Hi! I'm Diane. We're new to this list. So far, I really like it :-)

We are unschoolers in NY. We're having our share of problems. But I'll
share them as it goes along.

We are Christians. I really liked this article! I was so excited to see
that others were "unschooling" as well. Alll of the Christians we know who
homeschool all have school in the home. Very very rigid.

This was definitely refreshing!

Diane

> Date: Thu, 21 Oct 1999 21:32:04 -0400
> From: The O'Donnells <praxis@...>
> Subject: Christian Unschooling Article for those not on the net -LONG but
good!
>
> Christian Unschooling
>
> More Thoughts
> Jeanne Musfeldt
>
> Hello again! I thought I would just take
> some time today to let you know more
> about our unschooling. The things we do
> and how the children learn. But first, let
> me elaborate on the general idea of
> unschooling.
